synoptic.benchmarks
Class PerformanceMetrics

java.lang.Object
  synoptic.benchmarks.PerformanceMetrics

public class PerformanceMetrics
extends java.lang.Object

A class to record performance metrics. It is a key value store, that keeps record of the number of updates to each value. An update to a value (using record) will add the value to the previously recorded one. This also keeps track of a hierarchy of tasks: createTask adds a task to the task stack, and a call to the task's stop method pops it.

Author:
Sigurd Schneider

Field Detail

logger

private static java.util.logging.Logger logger

globalPerformanceMetrics

private static PerformanceMetrics globalPerformanceMetrics
A global performance metric instance to record statistics.

previousTask

private static TimedTask previousTask
The last created timed task. This is used to create a hierarchy of tasks.

values

java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> values
Holds the values measured for each metric. Consecutive measurements will be accumulated by addition here.

numberOfMesurements

java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long> numberOfMesurements
For each metric, this holds the number of different measurements that contributed to the measurement. E.g., if add("task", _) has been called three times, this will hold 3.

accumulativity

java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> accumulativity
Record whether the task should be accumulative or not. If a task is accumulative, it will not be divided by the number of measurements.

Constructor Detail

PerformanceMetrics

public PerformanceMetrics()
Method Detail

record

public void record(TimedTask t)
Record the task t. This will increment the number of measurements for that task name, and pop previousTask from the task stack.

Parameters:
t - the task to record

getAccumulativity

private boolean getAccumulativity(java.lang.String key)
Find out whether a task is accumulative

record

public void record(java.lang.String key,
                   long value)
Record a value. This will increment the number of measurements for the given key, and add the value to the value saved for that key. If no previous value has been recorded, the previous value is set to 0.

Parameters:
key - name of this measurement
value - the measured value

public static PerformanceMetrics get()
Returns the global performance metrics object

the timed task created

public static TimedTask createTask(java.lang.String taskName,
                                   boolean accumulativity)
Create a new task.

Parameters:
taskName - the task name. Choose something unique.
accumulativity - set this task to be accumulative
Returns:
the created timed task

getDataRelative

public java.lang.String getDataRelative()
Get the data averaged over recording numbers. That means every measurements is divided by the number of measurements for that key.

Returns:
the data in alphabetic order

getDataDividedBy

public java.lang.String getDataDividedBy(int divisor)
Get the data associated with the keys in alphabetic order.

Parameters:
divisor - the number to divide each measurement through (use for avg)
Returns:
data in alphabetic order
